instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not charging the battery
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no signs of damage. 

The battery usually charges normally but after some time if you disconnect and connect the charger again it wont charge the battery. It powers on the laptop just fine. 

Sometimes if you wobble the connector a bit it will start charging the battery, but after a while this doesnt work. 

Ive tried different chargers, different batteries, changed the DC in connector, and disconnected J6955. No change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not charging the battery
threads.message:
Do you get green light on Magsafe connector (when problem appears)?
What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not charging the battery
threads.message:
Sometimes the light stays green. Sometimes orange for a while and then turns off. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> stays at 3.4v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.5v

Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> just in case. No change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not charging the battery
threads.message:
Check continuity between DCIN board and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> (<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL>).
Magsafe light must always be on (green, or amber).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not charging the battery
threads.message: There is continuity between <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> and the pin of the DCIN board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not charging the battery
threads.message:
Then check <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/1 voltages when this problem happens.
Check trace from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>.

Also reball SMC...
